title: Implement Twitter API client
description:
Create module to post tweets/threads using Twitter API v2.

**File:** src/twitter.ts

**Key functionality:**
- Create TwitterApi client from env vars (TWITTER_API_KEY, TWITTER_API_SECRET, TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN, TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET)
- postThread function: posts array of tweets as a thread
- Chain replies using in_reply_to_tweet_id
- Return array of posted tweet IDs

**Tests:** src/twitter.test.ts
- Mock Twitter API
- Test thread posting with reply chaining
- Test error handling

**Note:** Full verification requires real credentials (Task 7)

title: Initialize state and first run
description:
Set initial version state and verify end-to-end flow.

**Steps:**
1. Get current latest version: gh api repos/openai/codex/releases --jq '.[0].tag_name'
2. Initialize state file: echo '0.92.0' > data/last-posted-version.txt
3. Commit and push
4. Manually trigger workflow from GitHub Actions tab
5. Verify workflow completes successfully
6. Verify no tweet posted (version already in state)

**End-to-end test:**
1. Set state file to old version (e.g., 0.91.0)
2. Trigger workflow manually
3. Verify tweet posted correctly
4. Verify state file updated to current version
5. Restore state file to current version

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Workflow runs without errors
- Tweet posts correctly when new version detected
- State file persists across runs

title: Set up Twitter Developer Account
description:
MANUAL TASK - User must complete this.

**Steps:**
1. Go to https://developer.twitter.com/
2. Sign up for developer account (free tier works)
3. Create a new App in Developer Portal
4. Set up OAuth 1.0a with Read and Write permissions
5. Generate Access Token and Access Token Secret

**Required credentials (save securely):**
- API Key (Consumer Key)
- API Secret (Consumer Secret)
- Access Token
- Access Token Secret

**Documentation:** https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/getting-started/getting-access-to-the-twitter-api

**Acceptance criteria:** All 4 credentials saved and ready for GitHub Secrets

title: Create GitHub Actions workflow
description:
Create workflow that runs every 15 minutes to check for new releases.

**File:** .github/workflows/check-release.yml

**Triggers:**
- schedule: cron '*/15 * * * *' (every 15 minutes)
- workflow_dispatch (manual trigger for testing)

**Steps:**
1. Checkout repo
2. Setup Node.js 20 with npm cache
3. npm ci
4. Run src/index.ts with Twitter secrets from env
5. Commit updated state file back to repo (if changed)

**Git config for bot commits:**
- user.name: github-actions[bot]
- user.email: github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com

**Secrets needed:** TWITTER_API_KEY, TWITTER_API_SECRET, TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN, TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET

**Verification:** Manually trigger workflow from Actions tab, verify it runs

title: Implement release notes parser
description:
Create module to extract New Features section from release notes markdown.

**File:** src/parser.ts

**Key functionality:**
- Find '## New Features' section using regex
- Parse individual features (lines starting with -)
- Clean up: remove leading '- ', PR references like (#1234) or (#9817, #9818)
- Return ParsedFeatures object with: features array, raw text

**Tests:** src/parser.test.ts
- Test extraction of New Features section
- Test handling of missing section (returns empty)
- Test PR reference removal (single and multiple)
- Test against actual 0.92.0 release body

**Verification:** Parse real release and verify clean feature list

title: Set up project structure
description:
Initialize Node.js project with TypeScript configuration.

**Files to create:**
- package.json (npm init -y)
- tsconfig.json (npx tsc --init)
- src/ directory structure
- data/ directory for state file

**Dependencies to install:**
- Dev: typescript, @types/node, tsx
- Runtime: twitter-api-v2, @octokit/rest

**Verification:** npm run build succeeds

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Project compiles with no errors
- All directories exist
- Dependencies installed

title: Implement GitHub release fetcher
description:
Create module to fetch latest stable Codex release from GitHub API.

**File:** src/github.ts

**Key functionality:**
- Use @octokit/rest to fetch releases from openai/codex
- Filter out alpha/beta/rc releases (only stable)
- Extract version from tag (rust-v0.92.0 -> 0.92.0)
- Return Release object with: version, tagName, body, url, publishedAt

**Tests:** src/github.test.ts
- Test alpha/beta filtering
- Test version extraction from tag name
- Mock API responses

**Verification:** npx tsx src/github.ts returns latest stable release

title: Implement main entry point
description:
Create main script that orchestrates the release check and tweet flow.

**File:** src/index.ts

**Key functionality:**
1. Fetch latest stable release from GitHub
2. Read last-posted version from data/last-posted-version.txt
3. If same version, exit early (already posted)
4. Parse new features from release body
5. Format into tweets
6. Post to Twitter (skip if DRY_RUN=true)
7. Update state file with new version

**State file:** data/last-posted-version.txt
- Simple text file with version number (e.g., '0.92.0')
- Created if doesn't exist

**Environment variables:**
- DRY_RUN=true: Print tweets instead of posting
- TWITTER_* credentials for posting

**Verification:** DRY_RUN=true npx tsx src/index.ts shows formatted output

title: Codex Changelog Twitter Bot
description: Automated Twitter/X bot that posts whenever a new stable version of OpenAI Codex is released, extracting and sharing the New Features section from release notes. Polls GitHub releases every 15 minutes via GitHub Actions (free tier). Reference: similar to @ClaudeCodeLog from marckrenn/claude-code-changelog.

title: Implement tweet formatter

**File:** src/formatter.ts

**Key functionality:**
- MAX_TWEET_LENGTH = 280 characters
- Format single tweet when features fit: header + bullets + release URL
- Create thread when content exceeds limit: split across tweets with (cont...)
- Truncate long feature descriptions to ~50-60 chars with ellipsis
- Handle empty features case gracefully
